title: 103_hr53
content: The text chunk discusses the amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding the treatment of capital gains and the introduction of a capital gains deduction under section 1201. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 introduces a capital gains deduction under section 1201. If a taxpayer has a net capital gain, 30 percent of it can be deducted from gross income. For estates and trusts, the deduction is calculated by excluding gains that are includible by income beneficiaries. In the transitional rule, the net capital gain considered shall not exceed gains and losses accounted for after the enactment date.
